runs.comm: Bond starts off with a slower delivery, Dilshan was way too early into the shot, he is struck on the hip
Ryder! super diving stop at backward point, a direct hit would have been a run out, his fielding accounted for Dilshan and Jayawardene in the first game
Jayasuriya prods this short ball towards the covers
back of a length ball, close to offstump, no room for Jayasuriya, who was looking to cut, he manages to dab it uppishly towards third man
Dilshan has holed out to deep square leg, great start from Bond, Dilshan comes down the track and swings it, not enough on that shot, and Guptill has an easy catch near the boundary
Bond ends the over with a sharp bouncer just outside off, Jayasuriya lets it go

New Zealand have two, Udawatte is gone, another batsman who is done in because the ball stopped on him, it was a back of a length ball outside off, Udawatte was halfway through the stroke before he checks his shot, the ball pops up towards point for a simple catch
length ball angling into middle, blocked towards the leg side
the ball shapes away from Jayawardene, who fishes at it outside off, nearly nibbles it through to the keeper
length ball on offstump, Jaywardene turns it with soft hands towards midwicket
back of a length ball angling across Jayasuriya, who pushes it towards the off side and sets off for a single, but is sent back
fantastic over from Mills, he finishes it with a short of length ball outside off, Jayasuriya pokes it towards cover
slightly slower from Bond, 126kmh, full and heading for leg stump, Jayawardene works it towards midwicket
this one is 138.4kmh, back of a length outside off, Jayawardene chops it towards cover
Jayawardene was looking to pull that one, it was a slower ball, 121kmh, he bottom edges it onto his body
120.3 kmh, just outside off, Jayawardene gets the single this time by jabbing the ball towards point
Jayasuriya almost perishes, he was aiming for midwicket after charging down the pitch, he mishits it and it sails just over mid-on
finishes the over with a cracking lofted on drive, takes a couple of strides down the pitch, takes it on the half-volley and gets it well over mid-on
Jayawardene shuffles way outside off, looks to swipe it to midwicket but inside edges it into his pads

Jayasuriya is gone, Sri Lanka's chances are fading fast here, the crowd has lost its voice, he goes for the short-arm jab this time, gets it high on his bat and the ball lobs up to Taylor at midwicket for a simple catch
an elegant straight drive from Sangakkara to get off the mark
well outside off, Jayawardene opens the face to try steer it past backward point, doesn't connect
overpitched on the pads, Jayawardene swings it away to the midwicket boundary, lands a few yards short of the rope, the crowd roars
great comeback from Mills, a yorker outside off, blocked towards the off side
length ball outside off, Sangakkara swings at it and misses
great shot from Sangakkara, backing away and lashing it towards point, Guptill dives full length to his left to cut that one off
Jayawardene walks across his stumps, tries to sweep an outside off, doesn't quite get hold of it, the ball rolls towards backward square leg
a length ball angling in, Sangakkara is beaten as he looks to push it towards mid-off
unlucky for Butler, Sangakkara tries to get an offstump ball towards midwicket but French cuts it to the fine leg boundary
Sangakkara charges down the pitch and tries a flamboyant loft over mid-on, doesn't connect with the ball, and that's another good over for New Zealand
a hit-me delivery from Mills, a high full toss outside off, Jayawardene powers it over mid-on, timing isn't great but enough to take the ball to the boundary
another easy hit for Jayawardene, another high full toss, Jayawardene makes room and slams that over mid-off this time
a wide for height as Mills responds with the bouncer, that was very short from Mills and sails over Jayawardene's head
a full, slightly slower ball from Mills, Jayawardene looks to muscle it past mid-on, but can't beat the fielder
length ball from Mills, Jayawardene takes a couple of paces and lofts that over mid-on, mistimed from Jayawardene, mid-on has to race back to do the fielding
wonderful shot from Jayawardene, it was full and on his pads, Jayawardene bends his knees and delicately sweeps it past deep backward square leg for a boundary
Jayawardene looks to swipe this outside-off ball towards midwicket but he misses
Vettori, Man of the Match on Wednesday, starts with a wide down the leg side
on middle stump, Sangakkara stands tall and punches it to mid-on
on middle and off, Sangakkara shuffles across and taps it towards deep midwicket
Sangakkara waltzes down the track to get to the pitch of the ball, flicks it towards deep midwicket, on the bounce straight to the fielder, only a single
shortish ball on off, Jayawardene waits on the backfoot and jabs the ball towards point
again Sangakkara takes a couple of paces down the pitch, a sweet swing of the bat sends the ball rocketing over the bowler's head
full and on the pads, turned behind square for a single
angling down the leg side, brushes Sangakkara's pads on the way to the keeper, loud appeal from New Zealand, turned down
full and on the pads, clipped towards square leg
Sangakkara waltzes down the track, Butler shortens his length, the batsman flicks it towards short fine leg, a direct hit from the fielder would have ended Jayawardene's stay
innovative shot from Jayawardene, just jabs a ball almost from off stump just past the keeper, Bond sprints across to field well
more improvisation from Jayawardene, walks across the stumps, bends his knee and sweeps the ball to the vacant long leg region for a boundary
slashed off the back foot towards deep point for a single
Jayawardene pushes this one towards mid-on for an easy single
overpitched outside off, an ugly heave from the usually graceful Sangakkara sends the ball towards midwicket
Jayawardene skips towards leg and cuts the ball towards point
lofts it towards long-off, Vettori  shouts "catch it" but the first bounce was just outside the ring
works a full ball towards midwicket
fantastic placement from Sangakkara, what a shot! he sashays down the pitch and whips the ball in the air, it bisects the deep midwicket and long-on fielders
angling into legstump, Jayawardene backs away and steers the ball towards third man by opening the face
fullish ball, Sangakkara flicks it powerfully, goes on the bounce to midwicket
slower ball from Butler, Sangakkara took a step down the pitch and played it with soft hands towards mid-off
Shot! Jayawardene knew exactly where the fielder was as he played that stroke, a pull-sweep over short fine leg, the perfect timing takes it over the ropes
Butler responds with a yorker, Jayawardene squeezes it out to the off side
a wide down the leg side, he'll have to re-bowl that one, fine leg is in the circle, so if Sangakkara got some bat that would have been a four
down the track and swings it towards midwicket, a bit of a bottom edge, but there's enough time for the batsmen to take two
Nathan McCullum's first ball is turned behind square leg
another ball that stopped on the batsman, Sangakkara was early into the shot and the ball lobs dangerously but it lands wide of the bowler

a well-judged catch from Ryder ends the Jayawardene show, a top edge swirled towards short fine leg, Ryder has to make some ground before he jumps to take an overhead catch with his back facing the wicket
Mathews is tricked by the turn, an outside edge takes the ball towards short fine leg, Ryder is in the action again, rifling in the throw, Sangakkara had to have his skates one to make his ground
pushed towards mid-on for a single
Nathan McCullum gets two in an over, could this be curtains for Sri Lanka? Mathews tries to whip it to midwicket, only to find Taylor waiting there
Oram's first ball is flatbatted towards mid-on
gets on the front foot and muscles it towards long-on
Rupasinghe gets off the mark by dabbing an outside off delivery towards short third man
fuller length delivery on the middle and leg, Sangakkara drives it to long-on
good length delivery down the leg side, Rupasinghe looks to flick it away, off the pads to backward square leg
great placement there again from Sangakkara, a full ball on the pads is whipped wide of deep midwicket, three fielders were interested in that one but the ball beats them to the rope
Rupasinghe blocks it towards square leg for a single
overpitched on off, flicked towards midwicket
a huge, huge appeal from Nathan McCullum, Rupasinghe was looking to sweep but misses and is hit outside off
come down the pitch to reach the pitch of the ball, but loses the grip on his bat as he looks to loft the ball, which swirls towards extra cover and lands safely
worked towards midwicket for a single
a bit of drift into Rupasinghe, who flicks the ball towards midwicket for yet another single
Rupasinghe tries a cheeky dab to third man, misses
low full toss on offstump, mistimed towards long-off
full and on legstump, Sangakkara skips outside leg and drives it to mid-off
low full toss on offstump, another single, this time to mid-on
this ball was just outside off, Sangakkara backed away to give himself room and slashes it past backward point
Sangakkara backs away again, Oram follows him with a leg stump yorker, Sangakkara edges it toawrds square leg for a single
Sangakkara takes a few steps down the pitch and lofts the ball towards long-on, mistimed and it lands just outside the ring
a low full toss, Rupasinghe gets down the track and lashes it back past the bowler
full and just outside off, inside-edge by Rupasinghe onto his pads
short and a bit of width, Rupasinghe rocks back and carves it towards deep point

Dropped a very difficult caught-and-bowled chance, Sangakkara stays in his crease and his full-blooded swing sends the ball flying back towards the bowler, there's more drama as Rupasinghe is nearly run-out as he attempts to get the back for the second, after many replays it is confirmed that he just made his ground
driven down to long-on for a single
full and heading for middle and leg, Sangakkara makes room and crashes the ball towards backward point, straight at the fielder

Rupasinghe brings out the scoop, doesn't time it too well, it's a tease for Shane Bond who's running after it, Bond puts in an athletic dive to just stop the ball an inch from the rope, many replays are needed to confirm Bond has saved a run for his side
crashed past extra cover by Sangakkara, fetches him a couple
good ball from Butler, full and of offstump, Sangakkara can only chop it towards cover
again full delivery, just outside off, Rupasinghe can only squeeze it towards point
Sangakkara attempts a paddle to a very full delivery outside off, gets it on the toe end of the bat and it dribbles towards short fine leg

he also keeps it full outside off, Sangakkara tries to power it past mid-on, doesn't beat the fielder, and he frustrated to miss out on that, the bat turned in Rupasinghe's hands as he played that shot
driven to long-off's right for a couple
swings it towards midwicket, "catch' is the cry but it lands well short of the fielder
a powerful reverse-sweep from Sangakkra, cut off at deep backward point, no boundary yet in this over
flighted delivery outside the off stump, Sangakkara lashes it towards sweeper cover
Rupasinghe stays on the back foot and pushes it towards mid-on for an easy single
starts with a sharp bouncer, Rupasinghe top edges a pull over the keeper's head
full ball outside off, Rupasinghe was backing away so much that he can't reach it, dot ball
low full toss does the trick for Bond, Rupasinghe gets it very low on his bat and can only lob it towards cover, Vettori completes a simple catch
that's a superb bouncer, the umpires thought whether to call that a wide for height but decided it was okay, another dot ball
a yorker outside off, slower ball as well, Kulasekara walks across and flicks it towards short fine leg
keeps it full, chopped towards point for a sngle, Sangakkara keeps the strike, brilliant over from Bond, he was on-target at the death in the previous game as well
Like the rest of New Zealand's bowlers, Oram keeps it full outside off, Sangakkara paddles it to fine leg
innovation from Sangakkara, his previous reverse-sweep was very square, this one is only a few yards to the left of the keeper
full ball again, Sangakkara reaches his highest Twenty20 score by punching the ball wide of mid-on, great running from Kulasekara to come back for the second
Sangakkara goes for the fine reverse-sweep again, misses the ball, he's annoyed with himself
Sangakkara shaped as if to go for the reverse-sweep but doesn't, Oram follows the batsman down the leg side, can;t stop Sangakkara from launching that towards the midwicket boundary
a great innings from Sangakkara comes to an end, he top-edges a pull back to the bowler, a killer blow from Oram, not to forget that's a dot ball as well, the crowd starts to head for the exit
a bouncer on offstump, the batsman flat bats it over the bowler's head, timing isn't enough to get a boundary
slow full toss on middle and leg, 118kmh,  Bandara gives himself room and flays that towards midwicket
overpitched outside off, Kulasekara's powerful drive doesn't beat the man at extra cover
Bond is on target again, a yorker outside off, Kulasekara bottom edges it towards point
this time the length is slightly shorter, Kulasekara can get underneath one finally, but he hits it too high with nowhere-near enough distance, the ball swirls towards Taylor at cover
an immaculate final delivery confirms New Zealand's victory, sticks to the full and outside off formula, the batsman misses and the ball goes through to the keeper
